ETYMOLOGY: Coined by Carl Linnaeus in 1758 from Modern Latin Mammalia, derived from Latin mamma ('breast, teat'), referring to the mammary glands.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A warm-blooded vertebrate animal of the class Mammalia, characterized by the possession of hair or fur, and in females, milk-producing mammary glands to nourish their young.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 哺乳动物纲（Mammalia）中的恒温脊椎动物，其特征是拥有毛发或皮毛，且雌性拥有乳腺来分泌乳汁喂养幼崽。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Whales are marine mammals that have adapted fully to life in the ocean.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 鲸鱼是完全适应海洋生活的海洋哺乳动物。
